intro: Werneria incisa var. pubescens, commonly known as the pubescent werneria, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing habit and small, elliptical leaves. The leaves are typically pubescent, or covered in fine hairs, giving the plant its varietal name. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. This plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
